content:
It sounds like you have a solid plan in place for segmenting and targeting your audience.

Using CRM data to segment your audience based on job function, industry, and company size is a great approach. This will help you tailor your messaging and content to specific groups, increasing the likelihood of resonating with them.

Marketing automation tools can be incredibly powerful in helping with personalization and customization of email campaigns. By using data and analytics to inform your messaging and creative assets, you can create more targeted and effective campaigns.

Your social media strategy sounds well-rounded, too. Using a combination of organic and paid advertising will help you reach a wider audience, and creating content that's relevant to your audience will increase engagement. Social media listening tools are also essential for tracking sentiment and engagement around your brand and product.

A/B testing is a great way to optimize your campaigns and improve performance over time. By testing different subject lines, CTAs, and creative assets, you can determine what's working best and make data-driven decisions to optimize your campaigns.

It's great that you're taking a data-driven approach to marketing. By using data and analytics to inform your decisions, you can create more effective campaigns and drive better results.

How do you plan to measure the success of your campaigns? Are there any specific metrics or KPIs that you'll be tracking to determine the effectiveness of your efforts?
